## Summary

| Adapter | Kind | Capabilities | Status |
|---------|------|--------------|--------|
| [nexus-router-adapter-http](#http-adapter) | http | apply, external, timeout | ✓ |
| [nexus-router-adapter-stdout](#stdout-adapter) | stdout | apply, dry_run | ✓ |

# Official Adapters

This file is auto-generated from adapter manifests.
To update, run `python -m nexus_router.docs`.

### http adapter

[![adapter-ci](https://github.com/mcp-tool-shop/nexus-router-adapter-http/actions/workflows/adapter-ci.yml/badge.svg)](https://github.com/mcp-tool-shop/nexus-router-adapter-http/actions/workflows/adapter-ci.yml)

**Package:** `nexus-router-adapter-http`
**Factory:** `nexus_router_adapter_http:create_adapter`
**Supported router versions:** `>=0.9,<1.0`

**Capabilities:** `apply`, `external`, `timeout`

#### Installation

```bash
pip install nexus-router-adapter-http
```

#### Usage

```python
from nexus_router.plugins import load_adapter

adapter = load_adapter(
    "nexus_router_adapter_http:create_adapter",
    base_url='https://example.com',
)
```

#### Configuration

| Parameter | Type | Required | Default | Description |
|-----------|------|----------|---------|-------------|
| `adapter_id` | string | No | - | Custom adapter ID (defaults to http:{host}) |
| `base_url` | string | Yes | - | Base URL for the HTTP endpoint |
| `headers` | object | No | - | Additional HTTP headers to include in requests |
| `timeout_s` | number | No | `30.0` | Request timeout in seconds |


#### Error Codes

- `TIMEOUT`
- `CONNECTION_FAILED`
- `HTTP_ERROR`
- `INVALID_JSON`

**Repository:** [https://github.com/mcp-tool-shop/nexus-router-adapter-http](https://github.com/mcp-tool-shop/nexus-router-adapter-http)

### stdout adapter

[![adapter-ci](https://github.com/mcp-tool-shop/nexus-router-adapter-stdout/actions/workflows/adapter-ci.yml/badge.svg)](https://github.com/mcp-tool-shop/nexus-router-adapter-stdout/actions/workflows/adapter-ci.yml)

**Package:** `nexus-router-adapter-stdout`
**Factory:** `nexus_router_adapter_stdout:create_adapter`
**Supported router versions:** `>=0.12,<2.0`

**Capabilities:** `apply`, `dry_run`

#### Installation

```bash
pip install nexus-router-adapter-stdout
```

#### Usage

```python
from nexus_router.plugins import load_adapter

adapter = load_adapter(
    "nexus_router_adapter_stdout:create_adapter",
)
```

#### Configuration

| Parameter | Type | Required | Default | Description |
|-----------|------|----------|---------|-------------|
| `adapter_id` | string | No | - | Custom adapter ID (defaults to 'stdout') |
| `include_args` | boolean | No | `True` | Include full args dict in output |
| `include_timestamp` | boolean | No | `True` | Include ISO timestamp in output |
| `json_output` | boolean | No | `False` | Output as JSON instead of human-readable |
| `prefix` | string | No | `'[nexus]'` | Prefix for output lines |
| `return_echo` | boolean | No | `True` | Return the call info in result (for testing) |


**Repository:** [https://github.com/mcp-tool-shop/nexus-router-adapter-stdout](https://github.com/mcp-tool-shop/nexus-router-adapter-stdout)
